history.content: I have no idea. I would contact the career center on bancroft.

children.subject: Many European universities have a mandatory internship period required for graduation, and these internships are usually sponsored / approved by the universities themselves. The company is likely looking for that university approval, but I'm pretty sure UC Berkeley (or any American university for that matter) actually provides it. If you can't find an answer at the career center, I might try explaining that difference to the company.

history.content:
I am not sure if this is the right place to post this but I was wondering if anyone knew what "internship agreement from the university" means? I have applied for an internship which is based in Paris and they asked if I could get this internship agreement. 

Thanks!!
history.subject: Internship Agreement ?????
